item.title: Python!
item.description: I’ve seen people use the API for Spotify to analyze their own playlists in Python. People have been able to modify their own Discover Weekly playlists and analyzed their own music taste. I’ve also seen someone compare their music with someone else’s and build a machine learning model to predict who a song was more likely to be listened to by, which I thought was really cool! It’s interesting how easy it is to use APIs with things you may use everyday, like Spotify, social media, games, etc.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a website for a project in Woodward's SDS 348 course at the University of Texas at Austin.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some projects I have been working on: Project 1 Project 2

item.title: Computational Biology Project 2
item.description: Aakansha Bagepally, ab49652 library(readr) grad_students <- read_csv("Desktop/college-majors/grad-students.csv") ## Parsed with column specification: ## cols( ## .default = col_double(), ## Major = col_character(), ## Major_category = col_character() ## ) ## See spec(...) for full column specifications. library(readr) recent_grads <- read_csv("Desktop/college-majors/recent-grads.csv") ## Parsed with column specification: ## cols( ## .default = col_double(), ## Major = col_character(), ## Major_category = col_character() ## ) ## See spec(...) for full column specifications. library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ────────────── tidyverse 1.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday's Markdown and Pandoc's Markdown.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

College Majors This folder contains the data and code behind the story The Economic Guide To Picking A College Major. All data is from American Community Survey 2010-2012 Public Use Microdata Series. Download data here: http://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/acs/data/pums.html Documentation here: http://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/acs/technical-documentation/pums.html college-majors-rscript.R Assumes you've already downloaded the data and selected only records with non-NA values for college major (FOD1P) Outputs data to csv majors-list.csv List of majors with their FOD1P codes and major categories.
